This Agreement is being executed with the intent to formally establish a binding understanding between the Employer and the Employee regarding the expectations and obligations associated with the employment relationship. The primary objectives of this Agreement are as follows:

ul.li: To ensure long-term commitment from the Employee towards PHN Technology Pvt Ltd., thereby safeguarding the substantial investment made by the Employer in training, development, onboarding, and upskilling of the Employee.

To foster stability, consistency, and continuity within operational and project teams by discouraging abrupt resignations, unauthorized absences, or abandonment of job responsibilities without due notice or cause.

To mitigate the risk of disruptions in service delivery, project timelines, and client engagements that may arise due to untimely departures, thereby preserving the company’s accumulated intellectual capital and organizational knowledge.

To establish a sense of professional accountability in the Employee for the technical training, managerial guidance, mentorship, and other forms of professional development support provided by the Employer during employment.

To secure a measurable return on investment (ROI) from the Employee in the form of sustained productivity, quality deliverables, adherence to performance standards, and active contribution to the organizational objectives and growth.

div.p: This section outlines the duration of the employment and the mutual commitments concerning the agreed-upon bond period.

The employment of the Employee under this Agreement shall formally commence on date
, which shall be referred to as the “Date of Joining”. From this date onward, all terms and conditions as stipulated in this Agreement shall become effective and binding on both the Employer and the Employee.

The Employee hereby agrees and undertakes to serve PHN Technology Pvt. Ltd. for a minimum uninterrupted period of ONE (1) years from the Date of Joining. This bond period represents the minimum tenure during which the Employee shall remain in active and continuous service with the Employer.

In exceptional circumstances, the minimum bond period may be extended further upon mutual written agreement between the Employer and the Employee. Such extensions may be necessitated by factors including, but not limited to:

ul.li: The nature or timeline of ongoing projects,
Any delays attributable to the Employee or external factors,
Specialized assignments or responsibilities requiring extended commitment.

div.p: Any such extension shall be documented in writing and signed by both parties to be considered valid and enforceable.
If the Employee:

ul.li: Voluntarily resigns, or
Is terminated by the Employer due to violation of company policies, misconduct, underperformance, or any reason deemed valid by the Employer

div.p: before the successful completion of the bond period, the following consequences shall apply:

a. Recovery of Bond Compensation:
The Employer shall have the right to recover a pre-determined compensation amount from the Employee, which shall cover the costs incurred in training, onboarding, and other resources invested by the Employer.

b. Forfeiture of Employment Benefits:
The Employee shall forfeit any entitlement to:
Full and final settlement of dues (subject to Employer’s discretion),
Issuance of the experience certificate, and
Issuance of the relieving letter.
These actions shall serve as a protective measure for the Employer’s interests and shall be enforced in accordance with applicable laws and internal company policies.

div.p: This section outlines the official designation of the Employee, along with the duties and expectations associated with the role, as well as deployment requirements during the period of employment with PHN Technology Pvt. Ltd.

The Employee shall be appointed to the position of
, a role that holds both instructional and mentoring responsibilities within the scope of PHN Technology Pvt Ltd.'s educational initiatives, especially in the domains of Robotics, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and STEM-based learning.
The Employee shall diligently perform the following duties and functions, in accordance with the company’s expectations and project requirements:

ul.li:
Delivering Technical Training Sessions:
Conduct interactive, hands-on training workshops and sessions on Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, and emerging technologies for students across schools and academic institutions, ensuring clarity and engagement at all levels.

Curriculum and Content Development:
Design, prepare, and periodically update instructional materials such as curricula, lesson plans, activity sheets, and multimedia learning aids. These resources must align with educational standards across various school boards including CBSE, ICSE, and State Boards.

Mentorship and Student Evaluation:
Guide students through project-based learning activities, assess their understanding and progress, provide constructive feedback, and support them in executing innovative practical assignments.

Team Collaboration and Coordination:
Coordinate effectively with internal and external stakeholders such as school faculty, lab coordinators, fellow instructors, and support staff to ensure seamless execution of training programs and events.

Adherence to Company Policies:
Maintain the highest standards of professional conduct and strictly comply with PHN Technology Pvt Ltd.’s Prevention of Sexual Harassment (POSH) policy, as well as all other ethical, disciplinary, and safety guidelines of the organization.

Exclusivity of Services:
The Employee shall not engage in freelancing, part-time employment, personal tutoring, or private coaching —whether online or offline—without obtaining prior written consent from the Employer.Any unauthorized engagement in such activities shall be considered a breach of contract.

p.p: The Employee’s compensation shall be reviewed on an annual basis subject to satisfactory performance, adherence to company policies, and completion of defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The increment framework is as follows:

ul.li: Upon Completion of Year 2: A performance-based salary increment in the range of 20% to 25% may be awarded based on the outcome of the formal appraisal cycle and individual contributions to organizational goals.

Upon Completion of Year 3: Subject to consistent performance, the Employee may be eligible for a further increment in the range of 15% to 20%, based on KPIs achieved during the second year of employment.

div.p: All increments are discretionary and based solely on the Employer’s appraisal process and performance benchmarks.

p.p: The Employer shall conduct a comprehensive performance review annually, which will evaluate the Employee across several parameters, including but not limited to:

li.strong: Feedback scores from students, schools, and institutional stakeholders
Adherence to prescribed curriculum structures and delivery formats
Effectiveness of presentation and communication skills
Technical proficiency and clarity in subject matter delivery
Professional behaviour and compliance with PHN’s internal policies, including conduct standards and ethical practices

p.P: In addition to the fixed compensation, the Employee may be considered for performance-linked incentives, bonuses, awards, or internal promotions, depending on:

ul.li: Demonstrated innovation in teaching methodology or project design
Positive feedback from client institutions and student cohorts
Noteworthy contributions to product development or process improvement

div.p: Such incentives shall be awarded solely at the discretion of the Employer and are not guaranteed.

p.p: This clause outlines the terms and conditions under which either party may terminate the employment relationship and the implications of such termination during or after the bond period.

p.strong: A. Termination for Cause by the Employer
p.p: The Employer reserves the right to terminate the employment of the Employee with immediate effect if the Employee is found guilty of any misconduct, breach of company policy, or unethical conduct. Termination for cause includes, but is not limited to, the following:

ul.li: Acts of misconduct or gross indiscipline, including insubordination, misbehaviour, or harassment of any kind.
Violation of internal company policies, including but not limited to the Prevention of Sexual Harassment (POSH) policy, confidentiality agreements, and IT/data security protocols.
Consistent underperformance or failure to meet defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) or project deadlines.
Involvement in theft, fraud, embezzlement, misappropriation of company property or funds, or unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information resulting in data breach or reputational damage.

div.p: In such cases, the Employer may terminate the Employee’s services without any severance pay, and legal action may be pursued depending on the severity of the violation.

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 5px; font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.3; margin-top: 0 !important; padding-top: 0 !important;

p.strong: B. Voluntary Resignation by the Employee During Bond Period
p.p: The Employee shall not be permitted to resign or voluntarily exit the company during the agreed-upon bond period of ONE (1) years. Any attempt to do so shall be treated as a breach of this Agreement,. and the following consequences shall apply:

ul.li: Forfeiture of Full and Final Settlement (FNF): The Employee shall not be entitled to any dues, pending salary, or benefits under the FNF process.
Non-Issuance of Relieving or Experience Letters:The Employee will not receive a formal relieving letter, experience certificate, or any supporting documentation from the Employer.
Adverse Reference: : The Employer reserves the right to issue a a negative or non-confirmatory referenceto any prospective employer or background verification agency.

div.p: These measures are aimed at ensuring the Employee honors their professional commitment and the company’s investment in training and development

p.strong: C. Exit Procedure Post Completion of Bond Period

div.p:
Upon successful completion of the bond term, the Employee shall be allowed to resign from their position by serving a minimum notice period of
days
in writing.

ul.li: If the Employee fails to serve the full notice period, the Employer shall have the right to recover an amount equal to two (2) months of the Employee’s gross monthly salary in lieu of notice.
This recovery shall be deducted from any pending dues or pursued legally, if necessary.

div.p: In the event the Employee breaches the bond agreement before the completion of the mandatory service period, the Employee shall be liable to compensate the Employer by paying an amount of ₹1,50,000 (Rupees One Lakh Fifty Thousand Only) or the total unearned salary for the remaining bond duration, whichever is higher.
This compensation covers:

li.strong: Costs incurred for training, orientation, and onboarding
Loss of productivity, project delays, and opportunity cost

div.p: The Employer reserves the right to recover this amount through legal proceedings or settlement channels if the Employee fails to make the payment voluntarily

div.p: This clause defines the consequences and legal implications if the Employee absconds, i.e., leaves employment without notice, approval, or formal communication, thereby violating the terms of this Agreement and professional ethics.

To this Agreement, abscondment shall mean an act wherein the Employee discontinues reporting to work or abandons their duties without providing any prior written notice, without obtaining proper clearance from the Employer, and without any valid justification for a continuous period of more than three (3) consecutive working days.

In the event of abscondment, PHN Technology Pvt Ltd. shall initiate legal proceedings against the Employee under the applicable provisions of the Indian Contract Act, 1872, and other relevant statutes. Such proceedings may include the recovery of dues, compensation for breach of contract, and any loss or damage caused to the company or its clients.

p.strong: Freezing of Financial and Salary Accounts

div.p: Upon confirmation of abscondment, the Employer reserves the right to:

ul.li: Freeze or withhold the Employee’s salary or any financial benefits that may be due as of the date of abscondment.
Suspend or revoke access to company accounts, portals, software licenses, and payroll systems.
Withhold any documentation, including experience letters, relieving letters, or service verification records.

p.strong: Liability of the Employee Upon Abscondment

div.p: The Employee shall be held personally liable and accountable for the following, and the Employer reserves the right to recover such damages:

p.strong: A. Recovery of Training and Project Investment:

div.p: The cost incurred by the Employer in onboarding, training, mentoring, and assigning the Employee to active projects will be recoverable.

p.strong: B. Loss of Client Trust or Business Relationships:

div.p: Any disruption of client services, delay in deliverables, or damage to reputation or client satisfaction resulting from the Employee’s sudden absence will be evaluated and legally claimed.

p.strong: C. Return or Recovery of Company Assets:

div.p: The Employee must return all physical and digital assets entrusted by the company, which may include but is not limited to:

ul.li: Company laptop
Identity cards
Access badges
Project documents or data
Any other material, devices, or property issued by the Employer

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 5px; font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.3; margin-top: 0 !important; padding-top: 0 !important;
div.p: Failure to return such items within the stipulated period will be treated as misappropriation of company property, and appropriate police complaint and recovery action shall be initiated.

This clause defines the standard working hours, expectations regarding flexibility, and provisions related to weekend duties for the Employee during the tenure of employment with PHN Technology Pvt Ltd.
The official working hours for the Employee shall be from 10:00 AM to 7:00 PM, Monday to Saturday. This schedule includes a designated lunch break and short recess periods as per company policy.

However, Monday to Saturday is not fixed as the standard working week, and the Employer reserves the right to assign any other weekday(s) as weekly off based on business or operational requirements. The Employee agrees to adhere to the weekly schedule as communicated by the Employer from time to time.
Given the nature of the Employee's role, which involves engagement with schools, educational institutions, and training schedules, a flexible work approach is expected. This includes:

ul.li: Adjusting start or end times based on the operational hours of assigned schools or institutions.
Early reporting or extended working hours during academic sessions, exams, workshops, or project deliverables.
Travel or on-site presence during field training or institutional assignments.

div.p: The Employee is required to exhibit adaptability and commitment to accommodate these dynamic requirements in alignment with client needs and organizational deliverables.

The Employee is expected to be available for work on Saturdays and Sundays, during active training periods, boot camps, school exhibitions, or project evaluation events. The need for weekend involvement will be communicated in advance and will be based on project schedules and client engagements.
It is explicitly agreed that:

li.strong: Weekend working requirements are factored into the Employee’s overall compensation (CTC).

ul.li: There will be no additional overtime or special pay for working on weekends, unless otherwise approved in writing by the management for exceptional assignments.
Compensatory offs, if granted, shall be at the sole discretion of the Employer, depending on project needs and work continuity.

div.p: The Employee shall be expected to fulfil their professional obligations with a spirit of responsibility and dedication, keeping in mind the company’s commitment to high-quality delivery and client satisfaction.

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 5px; font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.3; margin-top: 0 !important; padding-top: 0 !important;
div.p: As part of the employment, the Employer shall provide a laptop and other necessary assets to the Employee for official use. The Employee agrees to the following conditions:

ul.li: The laptop and other assets remain the sole property of the Employer.
The Employee shall not install or use any unauthorized or pirated software on the company-provided laptop or any other company asset.
The laptop must be used strictly in accordance with the Company Asset Policy, which prohibits personal misuse and mandates responsible handling.

In the event the Employee installs or uses any pirated or illegal software, or engages in any unauthorized digital activity that leads to legal, financial, or reputational damage to the company, the entire liability— including penalties, damages, or legal costs—shall be borne solely by the Employee.

div.p: This clause outlines the conditions applicable during the initial probationary period of the Employee's service with PHN Technology Pvt Ltd., including termination rights and bond enforcement terms upon confirmation.

The Employee shall initially be appointed on a probationary basis for a period of three (3) months, commencing from the official date of joining. During this period,the Employee’s performance, conduct, adaptability, and overall suitability for the role will be assessed by the Employer.
During the probationary period:

ul.li: Either party — the Employer or the Employee — may choose to terminate the employment by providing a minimum of seven (7) days’ prior written notice, or salary in lieu of notice.
No bond-related compensation or penalties shall apply if the employment is terminated within the probation period.

p.strong: C. Confirmation and Commencement of Bond Period

div.p: Upon successful completion of the probationary period and subject to satisfactory performance, the Employee will receive a formal confirmation letter from the Employer confirming their appointment as a permanent employee.

ul.li: From the date of such confirmation, the terms and conditions of the Employment Bond Agreement, including the mandatory three (3) year bond period, shall become fully binding and legally enforceable.
The Employee shall thereafter be obligated to honour the full bond term, failing which the penalties and liabilities outlined in this Agreement shall apply.

div.p: PHN Technology Pvt Ltd. is committed to providing each Employee with structured and comprehensive training to ensure they are fully equipped to perform their roles effectively and meet organizational standards.

p.strong: A. Nature and Scope of Investment

div.p: The Employer makes a significant investment, approximately ₹50,000 (Rupees Fifty Thousand Only) per employee, toward the Employee’s initial and ongoing professional development. This investment includes, but is not limited to:

ul.li: Technical training relevant to the domains of robotics, AI, and STEM education.
Soft skills training, including communication, leadership, time management, and collaboration.
Orientation in the use of hardware tools and software platforms required for instructional delivery and project execution.
Hands-on training for client interaction, classroom management, and support services during field deployment.

p.strong: B. Enforceability in Case of Early Resignation

div.p: In the event the Employee resigns or discontinues employment prior to completing the mandatory bond period, such an action will be treated as a breach of contract and a direct loss of investment made by the company.
As a result:

ul.li: The Employee shall be held liable under the terms of this Agreement.
The bond enforcement provisions, including recovery of training costs and compensation for premature exit, shall be legally invoked in accordance with Clause 7 and Clause 8 of this Agreement.

div.p: This clause reinforces the company’s expectation that Employees reciprocate its investment by committing to long-term service and delivering consistent professional performance.
This clause outlines the financial liabilities of the Employee in the event of a breach of the terms and conditions outlined in this Employment Bond Agreement.
The Employee expressly agrees that a breach of this Agreement shall be deemed to have occurred under any of the following circumstances:

ul.li:
a. Voluntary Resignation:
If the Employee voluntarily resigns or terminates their employment prior to the completion of the mandatory bond period of one (1) years, without any justifiable or mutually agreed cause.

b. Misconduct or Policy Violation:
If the Employee is found guilty of gross misconduct, serious negligence, or violation of company policies, including but not limited to the POSH Policy, Data Confidentiality Policy, or any other internal code of conduct.

c. Abscondment or Abandonment of Duties:
If the Employee abandons their duties or discontinues employment without proper notice, handover, or formal exit procedures, thereby disrupting project continuity and team operations.

Training and Development Expenditure

div.p: The Employee hereby acknowledges and agrees that this compensation is reasonable and proportionate to the loss suffered by the Employer in case of premature exit or misconduct, and that the Employer reserves the right to initiate legal action for recovery if the amount remains unpaid.

This clause defines the Employee’s obligation to maintain strict confidentiality regarding all proprietary, operational, and client-related information obtained during employment with PHN Technology Pvt Ltd.
The Employee hereby agrees and undertakes:

ul.li:
Not to disclose, share, disseminate, or misuse any confidential or sensitive information, including but not limited to:
Internal company documents and communications
Client data, contracts, strategies, and technical requirements
Training materials, curricula, source code, or algorithms
Intellectual property, business models, financials, or product plans
Confidential information may be communicated or used only for authorized work-related purposes and only with prior-written consent of the Employer.

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 5px; font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.3; margin-top: 0 !important; padding-top: 0 !important;
div.p: The confidentiality obligations under this Agreement shall remain in effect:

ul.li:
• Throughout the entire term of the Employee’s association with PHN Technology Pvt Ltd.,
and

• For a period of two (2) years following the termination or conclusion of employment,
regardless of the reason for exit (resignation, termination, or contract expiration).

div.p: The Employee confirms having fully understood the importance of data protection and agrees to uphold the company’s trust and integrity by ensuring strict non-disclosure and non-usage of any confidential information for personal, commercial, or third-party benefit.
This clause defines the ownership and rights over all intellectual property developed, authored, or contributed to by the Employee during employment with PHN Technology Pvt Ltd.

The Employee hereby agrees and acknowledges that all intellectual property created, developed, designed, authored, or contributed to—individually or jointly—during employment, shall be the sole and exclusive property of PHN Technology Pvt Ltd. This includes, but is not limited to:

ul.li: Software applications, source code, scripts, and algorithms
Electronic hardware or embedded system designs
Course materials, training manuals, and classroom resources
Learning Management System (LMS) modules and content
Project templates, lesson plans, and proprietary learning frameworks
Research reports, presentations, creative works, and documentation
Any other innovations, concepts, or technical developments

div.p: All such work shall be considered “work made for hire” under applicable Indian intellectual property laws.

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 5px; font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.3; margin-top: 0 !important; padding-top: 0 !important;

p.strong: B. Waiver of Rights and Royalties

div.p: The Employee expressly waives all present and future claims, ownership rights, patents, copyrights, royalties, or licensing entitlements in relation to the above-mentioned intellectual property.

ul.li: The Employee shall not assert authorship, share such materials externally, or repurpose them for personal or commercial use without written authorization from the Employer.
Any use or reproduction of these assets beyond the scope of assigned duties shall be deemed a violation of this Agreement and subject to legal action.

div.p: This clause shall survive the termination or expiration of employment. The Employee agrees that even after resignation, retirement, or separation from the company, they shall not disclose, replicate, distribute, or exploit any of the intellectual property in any manner whatsoever.

PHN Technology Pvt Ltd. reserves the right to take legal action in the event of any infringement, unauthorized usage, or misappropriation of its intellectual property assets. The Employee is expected to respect and uphold the company’s IP rights as a core part of their professional commitment.

For the position of Technological Educator and Operational Executive, it is mandatory for the employee to use their own two-wheeler vehicle (bike/scooty) for official visits to schools, colleges, and institutions within their assigned territory.
The employee must ensure the following:

ul.li:
The vehicle used complies with all applicable provisions under the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, including but not limited to:
Valid Registration Certificate (RC)
Valid Driving License
Valid Insurance Policy
Pollution Under Control (PUC) Certificate
Proper functioning of lights, brakes, horn, and other safety features
Use of a helmet is strictly mandatory at all times while riding the two-wheeler, in adherence to road safety norms and to ensure personal safety.

If the vehicle is registered in the name of a family member (such as a parent or guardian), the employee must submit a duly signed No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the registered owner authorizing the use of the vehicle for official duties.
The employee shall bear full responsibility for any legal, safety, or third-party liability arising from the usage of the personal vehicle during official work.

The company shall not be held liable for any personal injury, accident, vehicle damage, or legal penalties incurred during the use of the vehicle. However, in case of any injury or accident occurring during official duty, the employee may avail benefits under the employer-provided insurance policy, subject to the terms and conditions of the policy. In such cases, the company may also consider providing additional support on a case-by-case basis, at its sole discretion.

Fuel and travel expenses are already included in the employee’s Cost to Company (CTC) and shall not be reimbursed separately. This has been clearly explained and communicated to the employee during the time of joining and offer acceptance.

div.p: This clause outlines the restrictions placed on the Employee post-employment to protect the legitimate business interests, trade secrets, and competitive position of PHN Technology Pvt Ltd.

p.strong: A. Restriction on Employment with Competitors

div.p:
The Employee agrees that, for a period of twelve (12) months immediately following the cessation of their employment with PHN Technology Pvt Ltd., regardless of the reason for separation (resignation, termination, or contract completion), they shall not engage—either directly or indirectly—with any competitor organization
of the Employer.
This restriction applies to:

ul.li: Accepting full-time or part-time employment
Working as a consultant, advisor, or freelance professional
Founding, co-founding, or associating with a competing business
Representing or promoting any competitor's services

div.p: To this clause, a “competitor” shall be defined as any individual, company, organization, or entity engaged in one or more of the following business domains:

li.strong: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning Training
Technical Skill Development or Instructor-led Training Models

div.p: This includes both direct competitors and any entities with overlapping or derivative offerings in the Indian education technology and innovation space.

This non-compete restriction shall be enforceable throughout the territory of India, irrespective of the location where the Employee was deployed during their tenure with the Employer. This Pan-India applicability ensures protection of PHN Technology’s client base, training modules, and proprietary delivery systems.

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 5px; font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.3; margin-top: 0 !important; padding-top: 0 !important;
div.p: The Employee acknowledges and agrees that any violation of this clause would cause irreparable harm to the business and reputation of PHN Technology Pvt. Ltd. In the event of a breach:

ul.li: The Employer reserves the right to initiate legal action, including but not limited to seeking injunctive relief, damages, or specific performance.
The Employer may also notify relevant parties, including future employers or partners, of the breach and enforce legal consequences accordingly.

div.p: By signing this Agreement, the Employee confirms that this non-compete restriction is reasonable in duration, geographic scope, and subject matter, and agrees to comply in full to protect the business interests of the Employer.

div.p: This clause outlines the mechanism to be followed in the event of any disagreement, claim, or dispute arising between the Employer and the Employee in connection with this Agreement, or any matter relating to the terms of employment.

In the event of any conflict, misunderstanding, or disagreement between the parties, both the Employer and the Employee agree to first engage in good faith discussions and negotiations to resolve the issue amicably and without recourse to formal proceedings.

ul.li: The parties shall make every reasonable effort to communicate openly and reach a mutually agreeable solution through internal meetings and correspondence.
Any dispute, whether related to compensation, policies, performance, bond terms, or termination, shall first be addressed through internal dispute resolution mechanisms of PHN Technology Pvt Ltd.

div.p: If the dispute cannot be resolved through mutual discussions within a reasonable time frame (typically 30 days from the initiation of the dispute), the matter shall be referred to arbitration in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996, and any statutory amendments thereof.

ul.li: The arbitration shall be conducted by a sole arbitrator, jointly appointed by both parties. In the absence of mutual agreement, the arbitrator shall be appointed in accordance with the said Act.
The decision or award of the arbitrator shall be final, binding, and enforceable on both parties.
Place of Arbitration: The seat and venue of arbitration proceedings shall be Pune, Maharashtra.
Language: All arbitration proceedings, documentation, and communications shall be conducted in the English language only.

Jurisdiction: Subject to arbitration, any legal proceedings arising from or related to thisAgreement shall fall exclusively under the jurisdiction of the courts located in Pune, Maharashtra, and no other courts shall have jurisdiction.

div.p: This clause ensures that both the Employer and the Employee have access to a structured, fair, and enforceable process for resolving disputes, while preserving professional relations to the extent possible.
This clause outlines the legal framework that governs this Agreement and addresses the enforceability of its provisions.
This Employment Bond Agreement shall be governed by, interpreted in accordance with, and enforced under the laws of the Republic of India, without regard to any principles of conflict of laws.

ul.li: All rights, obligations, and remedies of the parties under this Agreement shall be determined exclusively as per the applicable Indian laws, statutes, and judicial precedents.
This includes, but is not limited to, laws relating to employment, contracts, arbitration, intellectual property, and confidentiality.
